pr_title: Remove Needless Context Switches on Loading RepositoryData

timeline.message:
Remove Needless Context Switches on Loading RepositoryData

We don't need to switch to the generic or snapshot pool for loading
cached repository data (i.e. most of the time in normal operation).

This makes `executeConsistentStateUpdate` less heavy if it has to retry
and lowers the chance of having to retry in the first place.
Also, this change allowed simplifying a few other spots in the codebase
where we would fork off to another pool just to load repository data.

timeline.bodyText: No need to fork for this here already, we might just be loading _current and never do any IO.
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: Moved this here since we now don't have to fork to the snapshot pool in the only caller (SnapshotsService) so it's much simpler to fork here where we actually do the IO.
timeline.author: original-brownbear
